title: Scenario 4: Mute Mode Tab-Specific Hiding
content:
Issue #47 Scenario 4: Mute Mode (Hide on Specific Tab)

**Purpose:** Verify Mute mode functionality where a Quick Tab is hidden only on designated browser tab(s) but visible everywhere else.

**Test Location:** tests/extension/issue-47-scenarios.spec.js

**Key Test Steps:**
1. Create Quick Tab in global mode
2. Toggle Mute mode on specific tab
3. Verify Quick Tab hidden only on that tab
4. Switch to other tabs - verify Quick Tab visible
5. Unmute - verify Quick Tab visible on all tabs

**Test Bridge Methods Used:**
- createQuickTab(url)
- getQuickTabs()
- toggleMute(id, tabId) - NEW METHOD
- getVisibilityState(tabId) - NEW METHOD

**Expected Behavior:**
- Mute mode hides Quick Tab only on specific tab
- Quick Tab visible on all other tabs
- Unmute restores visibility on muted tab
- Mute button state indicator changes (ðŸ”‡ when active)

**Implementation Status:** âœ… Implemented with new test bridge methods

**Test Pattern:**
```javascript
await helper1.createQuickTab('https://github.com');
const tabs = await helper1.getQuickTabs();

await helper1.toggleMute(tabs[0].id);
const visState = await helper1.getVisibilityState();
expect(visState.success).toBe(true);

// On second tab, Quick Tab should still appear
const tabs2 = await helper2.getQuickTabs();
expect(tabs2).toContain(tabs[0].id);
```

**Dependencies:** Solo/mute state manager, visibility controller
